writings.title: My only fear is you
writings.excerpt: You shimmer in my dreams like stars in the night sky...
writings.content:
You shimmer in my dreams like stars in the night sky,
You made the blind man see what love looks like,
And the deaf hear what the heart sounds like.
I have let go my fears in your sight—
Now my only fear is losing you.

writings.title: The ocean is a drop in front of your beauty
writings.excerpt: Thou soft whispers pass me like cold mountain breezes...
writings.content:
Thou soft whispers pass me like cold mountain breezes,
Your presence is my refuge of warmth — yet you give me
Those chilly shivers that run down my spine.
Oh my dear, my heart is electrified by them;
Now it beats to your rhythm.

When you are near, I feel an ocean of love within me,
Yet even this ocean seems a drop beside your love.
The waves within me sometimes fall still,
And silence pervades the space —
But a thought of your love restores my strength;
My stillness in silence is born of your love.

writings.title: An Apology
writings.excerpt: Today, hollowness fills my soul. With a heavy heart, my dear child, I have failed...
writings.content:
Today, hollowness fills my soul.
With a heavy heart, my dear child,
I have failed.

You needed only a little love —
But I knew none.
My fingers always pointed outward,
While I forgot to learn it myself.

Never did I have a lover —
But you, my child,
I forgot to give you what was yours.
I snatched it away,
And gave it to the wrong people.

For this sin I have committed,
I deserve the same fate as you —
To let the world
Snatch away my share of love.

You were never a failure, son —
But I, surely, am a failed father.

writings.title: Me and the Devil
writings.excerpt: The echoes of internal devil pin me down...
writings.content:
The echoes of internal devil pin me down,
My soul spirals down in a black void,
Hearing the devil I lament,
Fearing the pain of rebel I let him ramble.
Today, I let the devil show his callus,
While I listen and empathise.
For the fact I know he too woes from the same echoes —
Which I let to him through my ears.

writings.title: Unloveable
writings.excerpt: The heart aches, seeing—Every night drowning in emptiness...
writings.content:
The heart aches, seeing—
Every night drowning in emptiness,
Each day slipping by without love.
To survive this quagmire
Is to fight a war every day,
Between the urge to be loved
And the belief that I am unlovable.

I do not seek sympathy;
I seek peace in accepting the truth,
To pull myself away from this falseness
That drags me deeper into darkness.

The pain sharpens when someone shows affection;
Even these small drops of happiness sting.
Drops of water may make an ocean,
But these fragments of affection
Do not lead me to love.

writings.title: Flight beyond my feathers
writings.excerpt: The beads of roses have wrapped me in their warmth...
writings.content:
The beads of roses have wrapped me in their warmth,
Elated by their redolence,
I seek a flight beyond my feathers, Toward my home — the endless sky.

I have always feared this moment,
Unknowing of what lies beyond the sky.
Until now, I realize —
The true joy is in flying.

Let me rise, I love this ecstasy.
No one is here apart from me.
Fears have vanished, joy unbound —
I have reached where heights are gone.

writings.title: The Heart's Candle
writings.excerpt: My heart pounded, Darkness filled — Hollow, numb...
writings.content:
My heart pounded,
Darkness filled —
Hollow, numb,
A storm of unreal fears arose.

Yet from nowhere,
A warmth appeared.
The innocent heart lit a candle within itself,
To shield against the storm it had birthed.

The light glows, then fades,
The storms come, then go —
But the heart will always beat,
Not from choice,
Nor compulsion,
But from innocence —
And compassion.

writings.title: The Stars That Do Not Twinkle
writings.excerpt: Midst the darkness of the sky, they said the stars twinkle...
writings.content:
Midst the darkness of the sky,
they said the stars twinkle.

Hoping they would light my darkness,
I let them try to enlighten me
with their radiant beauty and bliss.

Only to realize
they are like a water mirage
in a dry desert —
hopeful from a distance,
but painfully elusive up close.

Yes, the stars twinkle,
but only from afar,
and never for fools
who expect them to brighten their darkness.

writings.title: The 'No-Knowing' God
writings.excerpt: There came flesh who asked the foolish question: 'Why was I born?'...
writings.content:
There came flesh who asked the foolish question:
"Why was I born? What am I here for?"

He asked the God he had believed in.
The God replied cunningly,
"Son, you were born to earn a living, do good, and serve your loved ones."

The beloved son of God believed
without a second thought.

But the God burdened him
with a weight he was never meant to carry.
To force a living being into existence —
A cosmic joke, cruel and absurd.

Against his will, he came;
His innocence taken for granted.

The God stole his free will
and gave him a lifetime of burdens.

Perhaps the God himself is confused
about His own Creator,
and so, in turn,
illusioned His own child.

writings.title: The tomb of existence
writings.excerpt: Conscious the being is, arriving from a womb...
writings.content:
Conscious the being is, arriving from a womb,
The seed of its existence was sowed,
In someone else's tomb.
The cycle of life where one must die for another one to live,
The being unaware of millions of sacrifices for it to be born,
The lives cannot return, yet in gratitude,
The being bows to every fallen life,
And grows from their dust - into its own becoming.

writings.title: Lost in Reflections of the Play
writings.excerpt: Life is a mirror, showing my reflections but not me...
writings.content:
Life is a mirror, showing my reflections but not me,
I trusted these illusions too seriously, completely losing me.

If I'm so pure, why are my reflections so evil?
Who told me what's evil?
The reflections that are not me.

Who told me that I am pure?
The very same reflections.

Who created this chaos?
Why did I become a part of it?
No one knows, except me,
Lost somewhere beyond the play.

writings.title: The Search for Light is darkness
writings.excerpt: The search for light is darkness itself...
writings.content:
The search for light is darkness itself,
The desire to gain is the desire to lose —
Identities, fears, and fleeting sorrows;
But seeker unaware clinges to all.

A wave once tried to know itself,
Only to vanish in the very attempt.
Another wave, in quiet surrender,
Discovered itself as the limitless ocean.

The search for light is darkness,
Yet the light forever shines.
Hidden not by distance, but by seeking,
Lost only to those who chase.
I am the creator of myself.

writings.title: Aryan says...
writings.content:
"Spirituality without Science is mere Religion"

"The meaningless universe owes no explanations to the creators of meaning"
